domains.description: Collects and normalises usage records from network elements or service platforms and prepares them for downstream rating and billing.

attributes.definition: Gathers raw metering or usage events (who used what, how much and when) from network, OSS or application systems and ensures completeness before processing.
Transforms heterogeneous or proprietary call detail records (CDRs) and session logs into a standardised format that billing systems can recognise – often called mediation.
Correlates related events, eliminates duplicates and applies business rules to ensure only valid usage is passed on to rating and charging.
Performs integrity checks such as syntax validation, fraud screening and format verification to catch errors early and prevent revenue leakage.

domains.description: Translates normalised usage data into monetary charges using tariffs, pricing rules and discount logic; supports real‑time charging and event‑based billing.

attributes.definition: Maintains price plans, rate tables and bundles including time‑of‑day, volume, roaming and demographic‑based pricing options to determine how usage is charged.
Computes charges for each usage event by applying the appropriate tariff, allowing consumption data to be turned into billable items.
Performs session‑based or event‑based charging in real time to support prepaid services, service control and immediate balance updates.
Defines and manages rating rules such as tiered pricing, peak/off‑peak, volume tiers or dynamic price surges, and ensures correct sequencing of rating logic.
